page.title: 01THE KENNET WILSHIRE BORDER
page.content: This is a very hilly area borders on the two hamlets of Foxfield and Little Bedwyn. The hills are divided by an ancient gap through which run a main railway line, a road, a canal and a river in paralell and in close proximity. The area is almost entirely given over to arable and dairy farms plus a stud and a pig factory. There is much woodland and water which support hunting and raising of game: deer, pheasant, partridge and trout. By the waterways are wetlands with uncommon wildlife: Orchids, Kingfishers and Water Voles. The human population of the area is very small. Many of the houses are of flint and brick with thatched roofs. Foxfield has, however, gained some new houses in the 1980's but has very recently lost its last shop and post office.
